headline.main: ENGLISH AFPAIRS.; Betrayal of Cabinet Confidence--France, England and America--Theatricals and Miscellaneous Matters.

docs.lead_paragraph: The talk of the Clubs and of Westminster Hall this week has been more about Sir JOHN YOUNG'S confidential dispatches, and how they came to be published, than about any other topic which floats upon the surface of attention.

headline.main: Entertainment to Hon. Daniel E. Sickles.; Speech of Mr. Jas. T. Brady, and Mr. Sickles' Response-Letters, &o. BALL AND SUPPER AT NIBLO'S.

docs.lead_paragraph: A brilliant fele, designed by Mr. SICKLES' friends to testify their gratification at his recent triumph as a candidate for Congress in the Third Congressional District, occurred last night in Niblo's Saloon. There was a large concouse of ladles and gentlemen-many of the latter well known by their public station or professional ability.

docs.snippet: Hon. HENRY BEDINGER, Ex-Minister to Denmark, died suddenly at his residence in Shepherdstown, Va., on the 26th of November. He returned home from Europe a few weeks ago, in good health and partook of a complimentary dinner tendered him by his...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hon. HENRY BEDINGER, Ex-Minister to Denmark, died suddenly at his residence in Shepherdstown, Va., on the 26th of November. He returned home from Europe a few weeks ago, in good health and partook of a complimentary dinner tendered him by his fellow-citizens. Mr. BEDINGER was formerly a member of Congress, and distinguished for the ability and energy he brought to the discharge of public duties.

docs.snippet: YOUNG LADY MISSING,--In our advertising columns will be found a notice of the disappearance from her home in Rye of a young lady, named Miss EMILY THOMPSON. She is supposed to have come to New-York on Saturday, while laboring under a temporary...
docs.lead_paragraph: YOUNG LADY MISSING,--In our advertising columns will be found a notice of the disappearance from her home in Rye of a young lady, named Miss EMILY THOMPSON. She is supposed to have come to New-York on Saturday, while laboring under a temporary aberration of mind. Her family are naturally in the greatest distress, and will be under the greatest obligations to any persons who can give them information concerning her.

headline.main: TUCKER vs. SICKLES.; Reply of the Hon. Gideon J. Tucker to the Personal attacks of the Hon. Daniel E. Sickles.

docs.lead_paragraph: A CARD. TO MY FRIENDS AND THE PUBLIC. DANIEL E. SICKLES, Member of Congress from the Third Congress District of this State, has recently delivered in New-York City three speeches, namely, on the 30th October, and the 3d and 19th November, in each of which he has assailed me in an Opprobrious and abusive manner.

docs.snippet: Although State reasons prevent the Queen from responding to the unanimous desire of the North American Provinces that that she should visit that portion of her dominions, Her Majesty has seized the occasion of the presence of several of the Canadian...
docs.lead_paragraph: Although State reasons prevent the Queen from responding to the unanimous desire of the North American Provinces that that she should visit that portion of her dominions, Her Majesty has seized the occasion of the presence of several of the Canadian Ministers to acknowledge the loyalty of her North American subjects by paying marked honors to their representatives. The Hon. Mr. Cartier on a special Invitation,
